question: Which of the following is also known as the "Ten Years of Spring"?
explanation: Guatemalan Revolution is also known as the "Ten Years of Spring". The Guatemalan Revolution was the period in Guatemalan history between the popular uprising that overthrew dictator Jorge Ubico in 1944 and the United States-orchestrated coup d'etat in 1954 that overthrew the democratically elected President Jacobo Arbenz. This period has also been called the Ten Years of Spring, highlighting the only years of representative democracy in Guatemala from 1930 until the end of the civil war in 1996, which saw the implementation of a program of social, political, and especially agrarian reform that was enormously influential across Latin America.
